titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3996) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-438, by Mr. McGovern.

All points of order against consideration of the bill except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI. The amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Ways and Means now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted and the bill, as amended.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 152.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 809.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215 - 185 (Roll no. 1077).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 185 (Roll no. 1078).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/9/2007--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3996) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions.
